qas.question: What religious movement affected education, politics, the economy, and marriage?
What churches let their clergy marry?
When did women join the Protestant ministry?
What types of churches have women had leading positions?
What priesthood rules do Protestant churches reject?

context: Although <a0_0>the Reformation<a0_0/> was a religious movement, it also had a strong impact on all other aspects of life: marriage and family, education, the humanities and sciences, the political and social order, the economy, and the arts. <a1_0>Protestant<a1_0/> churches reject the idea of a <a4_0>celibate<a4_0/> priesthood and thus allow their clergy to marry. Many of their families contributed to the development of intellectual elites in their countries. Since about <a2_0>1950<a2_0/>, women have entered the ministry, and some have assumed leading positions (e.g. bishops), in most <a3_0>Protestant<a3_0/> churches.
